summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Gerald M. LaPorte, a forensic chemist and document dating specialist. It details his extensive career with the U.S. Department of Justice, U.S. Secret Service, and other forensic science roles, along with his publications, instructional courses, and professional affiliations. The CV appears to be an exhibit in the Epstein case, likely submitted to establish LaPorte's expertise in document examination. This document appears to be a list of case citations and deposition dates from various court proceedings, likely an exhibit or attachment to a larger filing. It references numerous unrelated civil and criminal cases across multiple jurisdictions and dates from 2017 to 2020.

keyFacts: Gerald M. LaPorte is a highly qualified forensic chemist and document dating specialist with extensive experience at the U.S. Department of Justice and U.S. Secret Service.

LaPorte's expertise includes the chemical and physical examination of documents to determine authenticity, origin, and production method, which is directly relevant to document analysis in legal cases.
He has testified in court as an expert witness and before Congress on behalf of the Department of Justice, establishing his credibility as a forensic expert.
The CV lists numerous professional publications and instructional courses conducted by LaPorte, highlighting his role as a leading figure in forensic document examination.
This CV is marked as 'EXHIBIT J' in the Epstein case documents, indicating it was submitted as evidence, likely to qualify LaPorte as an expert witness for document analysis related to the case.
This document is a list of 17 unrelated court cases and depositions spanning from 2017 to 2020, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or associated parties.
The cases are from diverse jurisdictions including federal and state courts in the US, as well as international venues in France, Hong Kong, and England.

The document appears to be an exhibit or attachment, possibly part of a curriculum vitae or a list of prior cases handled by a legal professional or expert witness (as suggested by the header 'LaPorte CV').
The cases cover a wide range of legal matters including medical malpractice, criminal fraud, civil disputes, property litigation, and international arbitration.
No connections or substantive details about the Epstein case are present in this text chunk.
